snippet: Religious fervor has driven some to protect a once-bustling shrine outside of Damascus, while others see it as a target.
abstract: Sayeda Zeinab Journal; revered shrine of Zeinab in small town outside of Damascus has become key crossroads in Syria's civil war; tens of thousands of foreign Shiite fighters, galvanized by religious fervor, have come to country to protect shrine, which has been declared target by Sunni insurgents.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad and Sergey Ponomarev contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Religious fervor has driven some to protect a once-bustling shrine outside of Damascus, while others see it as a target.

headline.main: Muslim Shrine Stands as a Crossroads in Syria’s Unrest
headline.print_headline: Muslim Shrine Stands as a Crossroads in Syria’s Unrest

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
